Title: Cross River govt projects 90% budget performance for 2025
Summary: Cross River govt projects 90% budget performance for 2025, up from 85% recorded in 2024 fiscal year . Cross River State Government has projected a 90 percent budget performance .

Title: San Siro for demolition as AC Milan approve sale to Inter
Summary: Milan city hall approves sale of San Siro, nicknamed football’s La Scala, to Inter . Inter and AC Milan had both threatened to demolish the stadium . Inter had also threatened to sell the stadium to AC Milan .

Title: Nigeria to deploy 90,000km fibre optic nationwide – Lawmaker
Summary: Senator Shuaib Afolabi Salis says Nigeria is on the brink of a major digital transformation . He says the Federal Government is preparing to deploy 90,000 kilometres of fibre optic broadband nationwide .

Title: YouTube to pay $22m in settlement with Trump
Summary: YouTube has agreed to pay $22 million to settle a lawsuit filed by President Donald Trump . The company suspended his account over the January 6, 2021 attack on the Capitol .

Title: FCT NUJ mourns Arise TV journalist, calls for forensic probe into her death
Summary: FCT NUJ mourns Arise TV journalist, calls for forensic probe into her death . Somtochukwu Christelle Maduagwu was killed during a violent armed robbery attack at her residence in the FCT .

Title: Saliba signs new five-year deal at Arsenal
Summary: Saliba had been expected to extend his stay at the Emirates despite earlier reported interest from Real Madrid . The 24-year-old had earlier been linked with a move to the Emirates .

Title: Lagos reopens Ogudu-Ifako bridge after repairs
Summary: The Ogudu/Ifako Bridge inbound Alapere was originally expected to be ready in 100 days . The repair works were completed in just 73 days .

Title: Donate Blood, Save a Warrior
Summary: Sickle cell disease is one of Nigeria’s most urgent yet overlooked health challenges . Each year, about 150,000 babies are born with the condition, the highest number in the world .

Title: Two killed, palace razed in Borno community after Boko Haram invasion
Summary: The terrorists also set ablaze several houses, including the palace of the District Head of Kirawa, Alhaji Abdulrahaman Abubakar, shops and other structures .

Title: Onigbongbo set to become gateway of tourism, hospitality in Lagos – Adebanjo
Summary: Executive Chairman of Onigbongbo LCDA, Hon. Moyosore Adebanjo, reaffirmed the council’s commitment to positioning the council as the gateway of tourism and hospitality in Lagos .
